therml.name: TherML
responsibilities: Developing Faster-RCNN object detection models for the identification of thermal objects in thermograms.
Constructing pipelines on AWS for training, evaluation, and inference.
Integrating model predictions with a LLM report summariser.

dissertation.name: Dissertation
dissertation.position: [Exploring and Understanding Cross-Lingual Transfer to Catalan and Galician via High-Resource Typological Relatives](/projects/dissertation/)
responsibilities: Implemented cross-lingual transfer by fine-tuning RoBERTa and T5 models across many NLP tasks.
Utilised an innovative embedding pruning technique to create simulations of small multilingual models from MMTs, circumventing my resource limitations.
Used statistical methods such as Euclidian Distance and MDS to identify the potential implications of language typology on model performance.

jcr.name: Magdalene College JCR
responsibilities: Produced and led a complete redesign of the college's internal newsletter, coordinating and editing regular articles from 12 student writers and artists.
Contributed to and helped design the committee's website.
Arranged, presented in and minuted JCR meetings, including meetings with senior staff.

extras.dissertation: [Exploring and Understanding Cross-Lingual Transfer to Catalan and Galician via High-Resource Typological Relatives](/projects/dissertation/), Graded Distinction
extras.awards: Bundy Scholarship (2024), Peskett Prize (2024), College Scholarship (2022, 2023), College Prize for Linguistics (2022, 2023)

skills: PyTorch, Transformers, AWS (SageMaker, Lambda), NumPy, spaCy, Praat
